comment.author: 32569896@N02
comment._content:
The Church is still there and the place looks as beautiful .
Glengarriff – An Gleann Garbh (the rugged glen) is a name derived from the rugged beauty of the mountains and wooded valleys surrounding the village. Indeed there are many magnificent views of mountains and valleys from many viewpoints which hug the coastline that leads into Glengarriff.

Glengarriff is a gateway to the Ring of Kerry and Beara Peninsula and is a picturesque village with all the charm of West Cork.   There is a fantastic selection of shops, traditional bars and restaurants to choose from in this charming village where you will find a traditional warm West Cork welcome. Lots of activities also available close by golf course, water sports walking lots to do and see.

Garnish Island close by is also very beautiful and should not be missed.
